item.title: Roadblock/barriers moved back into communal garden, 27th August
item.description:
Blocking the pathways in the communal garden and access to downstairs flats, used as football goals for children’s play creating noise nuisance also. They were used to block the play street for cyclists and pedestrians previously.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Murrain Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More St George’s graffiti, 27th August
item.description:
On the path up to ten tennis courts. More reported by the tennis courts. There might be more I haven’t spotted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. John's Terrace, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin, 27th August
item.description:
Overflowing bin with bags of dog waste, and pizza boxes with half eating pizza on the ground. This will attract more dumping or rubbish, as well as rats and other vermin. The bin is located at the entrance of the alleyway on Kingsville Road. This alleyway is the one that passes through the allotments.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree managed By Council is Leaning towards my Property and It's used to get into my property by thieves and Vandals, 27th August
item.description:
Hi, I need the tree behind of my property that is serving as a security risk to myself and family to be cut down. I initially opened a case and it is yet to be resolved but the case was closed. The tree and forest is managed by the council but it has not been attended to in the last 5 years and it has overgrown and serving as a security risk to my family. We are under constant threats of attyack. Kindly attend to this with great sense of urgency.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Hodson Crescent, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of rubbish & cardboard boxes dumped be the litter bin on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17 near the 401/469 bus stop., 27th August
item.description:
A large quantity of cardboard boxes and several bags of rubbish have been dumped by the litter bin on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17 near the 401/469 Bus Stop, approximately 25 metres from the junction with Halt Robin Road. Would arrangements be put in place to remove the rubbish as soon as practical.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tool dropped from height, 27th August
item.description:
I was walking past elevated platform when I saw a chisel drop from the scissor lift . The chisel ended up in the road (it may have bounced off one of the struts of the scissor lift) i family had just walked by. I challenged the worker on the platform lift and told him that this was a dangerous incident and someone could have been killed. I asked why the tools were not tethered to their wrists which would have prevented such an incident . I advised the operatives that I would advise the council of the incident

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Great Peter Street, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All 5 litter bins completely full, 27th August
item.description:

item.title: Vandalism and graffiti, 27th August
item.description:
This is vandalism and graffiti for political gain. I don’t think this should be allowed. These are public crossings and shouldn’t be added into political agendas.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Commercial Way, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti and vandalism, 27th August
item.description:
This insight hatred this is political graffiti and vandalism. The same political party who were against Greenwich Council painting the crossings with rainbows are now encouraging people to vandalise the crossing with St George flags.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peninsular Park Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
